When a light source illuminates an object, the shadow forms in the area where light is blocked.
As light moves backward (away from objects), shadows shift closer to being directly beneath their respective objects.
As light moves backward, shadows become smaller and more defined (less diffuse).
Shadow A is elongated and displaced from directly beneath the hat.
